+x ero Exactly. You are making my point for me. Population density is a big 
factor that you must control for. Gangs, educational opportunities, local 
criminal culture, etc, etc, etc,etc. There are thousands of variables. 
If we want to find out if gun laws help, a simple comparison of New Mexico 
to Illinois doesn't tell us much does it? 
You have those same issues trying to compare one country to another. There 
are different policing techniques, different social support networks, a 
different primary culture & a different criminal culture. They even use a 
different definition of murder for statistical purposes. A simple 
comparison between say the US & Australia will tell you that the recorder 
murder rate in the US is higher than Australia but it doesn't tell you why. 
(causation)
To establish causation you must look at the same population before & after 
introducing the independent variable (what you are testing. In this case, 
it's gun laws) 
If you want to find out if gun laws helped reduce murder rates in Chicago, 
you must look at Chicago the year before & the year after passing new gun 
laws. That assures that other variables stay as close to the same as 
possible. 
That is basic scientific method. You compare Chicago before gun laws to 
Chicago after new gun laws.

I was shooting guns when I was in 1st grade.. granted, never a fully 
automatic uzi.. but I learned the essentials of gun safety from an early 
age. When I got older, my older friends would do stupid stuff like point an 
unloaded gun at someone and then get confused when I go off on them. It's 
because it was drilled into my head from an early age.. always assume it is 
loaded and always assume it can go off at any time. I try to explain it to 
grown men, and they literally just don't get it. I'm a firm believer in 
children learning about firearms, however I'm also a firm believer that 
nobody that young should be handed an automatic weapon.

Frankly, I'm a little conflicted on the whole gun issue, because many 
people are just flat out too stupid to be trusted with one. There is an 
abundance of video evidence that supports that. I wouldn't mind stricter 
gun regulation.. like an IQ test.
